ex_en: A Cantonese proverb: Symbolizing someone with ability or courage venturing out into new regions, it's also a sarcastic term for someone with an unattractive appearance, subtly mocking their looks and self-confidence. "Those without real talent dare not venture out; only those who aren't pretty enough need heavy makeup."

ex_en: Each segment of the game is paired with a punch, forming a "best-of-three" match. There's also a saying that it's like "a mouse won't eat a red bean bun," implying that a winning streak eliminates the need for a third round.

ex_en: He takes credit for his achievements, but shirks responsibility when problems arise.

ex_en: Look how silly she/he is, he/she seems so stupid.

ex_en: He's like an idiot. He couldn't understand why I am saying no matter how many times I explained to him.

ex_chs: 容人龇牙咧嘴地笑的样子
ex_en: The way he grinned with his teeth showing.

ex_zhh: 咪傻傻閪閪噉俾人揾笨啦
ex_en: Don't be silly and get scammed!

ex_zhh: 佢咁大個人，仲系蒸生瓜咁樣

ex_en: He's so old, yet he's still so naive and clueless in his interactions with others, like an immature child.

ex_chs: 歇后语：瓜还没完全熟透，还处于半生熟的状态，形容人不成熟，傻傻的
ex_en: Chinese proverb: The melon isn't fully ripe yet; it's still in a semi-ripe state. This is used to describe a person as immature and foolish.

ex_chs: 你找了个冤大头回来，什么时候捞一笔
ex_en: You've brought back a sucker; when are you going to make some money off him?

ex_chs: 对亲家；原意两个男生同时和一个女生谈恋爱

ex_chs: 找了个男朋友；有一种找了个大冤种回来的意思

ex_en: I have to spend every night with my godfather.；This generally refers to a young woman serving an older man with the sole purpose of profiting from him.

ex_chs: 不要相信他/她，明显在欺骗你
ex_en: Don't believe him/her, they are clearly deceiving you.

ex_en: There are many kinds of fools, but I've never met one like you before. You're truly foolish to the extreme.

ex_zhh: 到宜家都唔知錯系邊度，真系傻到冇朋友
ex_chs: 到现在都不知道问题出在哪里，真的傻到一个点
ex_en: I still don't know where the problem lies; I'm incredibly stupid.

ex_chs: 这么不应该的事情你都做？对你没好处
ex_en: You actually did something so wrong? It's not good for you.

ex_en: You put effort into doing things you shouldn't do, while you do the things you should do carelessly, turning your life upside down.

ex_en: This guy who thinks he's so handsome looks so much like you.

ex_en: She/He stared blankly at the cake, lost in thought.

ex_en: It is a metaphor for a person being as dull, rigid, and slow to react as a piece of wood, or it describes a person as clumsy and inflexible.

ex_chs: 比喻像木头一样呆板的人
ex_en: A metaphor for a person who is as rigid as a block of wood.

ex_chs: 搭错线，电线短路（烧坏了）啊，通常讲人脑神经短路即烧坏脑。
ex_en: The wrong wire was connected, causing a short circuit (burning out). In general, a short circuit in the human brain is equivalent to burning out the brain.

ex_chs: 指人的脑子有问题，二百五。
ex_en: It means that the person has a problem with their brain.

ex_zhh: 你黐筋，我嚟搵人着咩校服
ex_chs: 你神经病，我来找人穿什么校服
ex_en: Are you crazy? I'm here to find out what school uniform someone is wearing.

ex_zhh: 人蠢冇藥醫，醫咗變白痴
ex_chs: 人太笨了治不好了，就算有药也吃到傻
ex_en: The person is too stupid to be cured; even if there were medicine, it would only make them stupid.
A fool who only moves when kicked.

ex_chs: 用于骂人，形容人像木桩那样站在那里不动。当时英国的木条叫mullion，指着叫华人拿起来装上，不会英语的我们听成茂利，在取笑同僚“在说你呢，一根木头那样站在这愣着”
ex_en: It was used as an insult to describe someone standing there motionless like a wooden stake. At the time, the British called a "mullion," and when they pointed at it, they were telling the Chinese to pick it up and install it. We, who didn't understand English, misheard it as "Maoli" and were mocking our colleague, saying, "We're talking about you, standing here like a log, completely dazed."

ex_zhh: 扑街仔！你扑街囖，明知会扑街，都仲要扑過去，家下扑晒街囖，正扑街嚟噶，扑街啦你
ex_chs: 傻子!你完蛋了，明知会跌，还要往那方向去，现在真失败了。真是犯贱啊!活该啊你!
ex_en: You idiot! You're doomed. You knew it would fall, yet you still went in that direction. Now you've truly failed. What a fool you were! You deserve it!
You brat, you didn't even wait for me!

ex_chs: 一个极度恶毒的粤语粗话，意思是诅咒对方“全家死光”或“全家倒霉
ex_en: This is an extremely vicious Cantonese swear word that means to curse the other person's "entire family to die" or "entire family to suffer bad luck."

ex_chs: 该硬的时候不硬，浪费机会；形容应该出风头时不出来
ex_en: Failing to stand up when you should has wasted an opportunity; describes someone who doesn't step up when they should be in the limelight.
Realizing he was being foolish, he did something stupid.

ex_zhh: 你唔係咁笨柒，咁都信啊嗎？
ex_chs: 你不会这么蠢，这样都相信吧
ex_en: You can't be that stupid to believe something like that, right?

ex_chs: 歇后语；非洲和尚是黑人“僧” “僧”是讨厌的意思，乞人憎=令人讨厌
ex_en: A Chinese proverb: African monks are black "monks" (僧). "Monk" (僧) means annoying or disliked; therefore, "a hateful person" (乞人憎) is the same as "annoying" (令人讨厌).
Being ugly is not a mistake

ex_chs: 因为什么原因进来？因为倒霉
ex_en: Why did you come in? Because of bad luck.

ex_zhh: 有鸠用咩/有撚用咩/有叱用咩

ex_chs: “去你妈的混蛋”，骂人的脏话[口语]
ex_en: 'fuck you you bastard', foul language when cursing someone [colloquial]

ex_chs: 做不做或者好不好或者我爱你
ex_en: Do it or not, or good or bad, or I love you.

ex_chs: 准备要说对不起了或者不好意思
ex_en: I'm about to say sorry or embarrassed.

ex_chs: 去你的这么久都做不完
ex_en: Screw you, it's been so long and you still can't finish.

ex_zhh: 屌你老母我忍你就食得屎啦
ex_chs: 我操你妈，我忍你我就是孙子
ex_en: I'll fuck your mum. If I put up with you, I'd be a coward.
FUCK HIS MOM! HIT THE HARD!
Screw it, they won't release him.

ex_zhh: 屌到你反艇就問你驚唔驚
ex_chs: 操到你爽，就问你怕不怕
ex_en: I'll fuck you until you're satisfied, then I'll ask you if you're scared.

ex_zhh: 你真系笑撚死我，咁噶嘢都做得出
ex_chs: 真的笑死我了，这样的事你都能做出来
ex_en: This is absolutely hilarious! How could you do something like this?

ex_chs: 可以是被骗被宰，也可以是抢劫
ex_en: It could be being scammed or ripped off, or it could be robbery.

ex_chs: 也可以上升为绑架的意思
ex_en: It can also be interpreted as kidnapping.

ex_chs: 原指男同性恋，后来演变成骂人的话
ex_en: Originally referring to male homosexuality, it later evolved into an insult.
How could it be so ugly?
It's so ugly it makes me want to cry, it's so disgusting I want to call the police.
